TopicTitle: Fixing Science III: The Discussion Thread that tries to find films I and II

Articles.Content: It seems that a lot of us here are still unsatisfied by how the current science system works, but aren't doing a lot of talking to each other to try and figure out how we can fix it. Well, let's start talking...how can it be fixed?

Well, if you're going to start a discussion, you should probably begin with exactly what you think is wrong with it. There's already a thread on how it's too grindy, so you might want to find something else you think is wrong with it. You can't discuss a solution without a clear problem statement.

There isn't enough for kerbals and probes to do. Imagine a robotic scoop, A spectrometer, a scale even. With enhanced IVA imagine moving around the science labs, using various instruments to construct an image of what happened to that particular sample and to deciphering its chemical composition. The spectrometer would be a notebook containing all of the various chemical indicators, and an actual spectrometer that would give you the results but YOU would have to decide the soils chemical makeup. The same may be true for probes imagine uploading your results back to KASA, where chemists (the player) would decipher the chemical make up of soil, but the wouldn't be certain until a manned mission confirmed the data or a sample has been returned.
Because science still isn't actually 'doing' anything. You push a button. Receive bacon. You ran out of bacon? Buy a new thing you can get more button-pushes and bacon with. Ooo, such excitement.

My main problems with the science system are as follows:

-Not enough experiments to do: There are six. Only four of those are really sized to go on probes, and most planets don't need one of them. I'd love to be able to see about twice as many, used in different areas for different things.

-Transmission. Full stop. in the first version it's exclusively useful, in the new one its almost entirely useless. There need to be experiments which are designed to be transmitted (the temperature, the barometer, etc.), and some which need to be returned.

-Unlocks: The tech tree is... confusing. Makes little sense (how the hell do we unlock the 'Mainsail's little brother' before the ACTUAL mainsail?!), and quite a few of the science bits are unlocked way too late unless you rush for them.

-Science lab: It's a step in the right direction, but... Sheesh. There are KERBALS ON IT. If we want to get them home, there is currently NO reason to use it!

-The thing is... I mean, there's no challenge to it. Like Frost said, push button, receive bacon.

That is all.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/64665-Look-here%21-I-found-a-use-for-the-lab%21

That is all.

Okay, let me rephrase.

The lab has two functions. One of which is utterly useless, and the other is a fix to a fix to try and fix the brokenness of the first iteration.

Whoop de do.

I love this game. The career mode is awesome - makes you work for the good parts, but the science has reached a point where it makes far more sense to send un-kerballed probes everywhere ( I can pull 1-2x unmanned versus manned with lower resource requirements). Then revisit with kerbals and get like 20 science. How is that cool? Disappointing. I had to make the mun my mistress with unmanned probes to get enough science to get a kerbal there. Great! Now if I send a kerbal, it's just for sight seeing.

I think most of the excitement around this game is the idea of manned spacefilght. If I was wrong, NASA's unmanned plans would get much more public excitement.

Sending kerbals somewhere should be worth far more - it certainly is worth more effort.

Again - great game - and I do understand that science is heavily in the works. I shouldn't have to return with a LEM from Duna to get 3x the science though. (and yes I know science transfer/lab argument - weak).

...but the science has reached a point where it makes far more sense to send un-kerballed probes everywhere ( I can pull 1-2x unmanned versus manned with lower resource requirements). Then revisit with kerbals and get like 20 science. How is that cool?

I think that might be part of the problem. Right now, the only things that NEED a kerbal are EVA and surface samples (the crew report, bizarrely, just needs a seat). Everything else overlaps. It doesn't help that those two aren't terribly valuable as far as effort goes.
